qas.question: What was the reason that the British Prime Minister thought that ware in Europe could be prevented?

answers.text: the new series of alliances could prevent war from breaking out in Europe
the French opened the campaign against the British by an attack on Minorca

qas.question: What was the result for Admiral Byng?

answers.text: Admiral Byng was court-martialed and executed

qas.question: When was war declared between Britain and France?

answers.text: War between Britain and France had been formally declared on 18 May

qas.question: How did the timing of the declaration of war compare to the conflicts in North America between Britain and France?

answers.text: nearly two years after fighting had broken out in the Ohio Country.

context: The British Prime Minister, the Duke of Newcastle, was optimistic that <a0_0>the new series of alliances could prevent war from breaking out in Europe<a0_0/>. However, a large French force was assembled at Toulon, and <a1_0>the French opened the campaign against the British by an attack on Minorca<a1_0/> in the Mediterranean. A British attempt at relief was foiled at the Battle of Minorca, and the island was captured on 28 June (for which <a2_0>Admiral Byng was court-martialed and executed<a2_0/>). <a3_0>War between Britain and France had been formally declared on 18 May<a3_0/> <a4_0>nearly two years after fighting had broken out in the Ohio Country.
